sub_title: Connector ‚ú± Impact Design Startup Curator & Consultant ‚ú± Program Manager @What Design Can Do ‚ú± Founder @Cross Change
summary:
üëãüèº Hey, I‚Äôm Tuƒü√ße. You can reach me to ask; 
‚ûñ to design impact-driven learning and discovery programs, 
‚ûñ to develop creative entrepreneurship programs, 
‚ûñ to scout and curate impact-driven design startups & solutions, 
‚ûñ to speak about the power of design for a systemic transformation, impact-driven design, holistic design, and circular design.

‚úö I‚Äôm a designer in heart, with a decade-long background in spatial design, creative direction, and production design in the film industry. In addition to that, I have hands-on experience in social innovation, design curation, and learning journey design and all for a healthier planet and better society. 

üìÆTo stay updated about the impact design ecosystem, subscribe to my Cross Change Curated newsletter on LinkedIn.

‚úö I‚Äôm the founder and the director of an impact-driven creative studio and conscious design startup matching platform Cross Change. I love helping organizations and brands to activate their environmentally and socially conscious vision through impact-driven creative projects such as learning programs, co-design workshops, communication formats, and interview series. 
üö©For more visit: crosschange.co

projects: [{'title': 'Spatial Speculations', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': '‚ÄúSpatial Speculation‚Äù is a citizen-oriented research pro- ject that focuses on the effects of socio-cultural and geographical differences on the use and the needs of public space that will be carried out through digital communication channels. Within this research project, we aim to gather relevant data from the citizens of both selected countries about their non-functioning public spaces. We aim to transform the data we‚Äôll gather into design proposals, and want to share those design proposals publicly to attract relevant parties to mould public opinion.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Tugce', 'last_name': 'Akbulut', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Connector ‚ú± Impact Design Startup Curator & Consultant ‚ú± Program Manager @What Design Can Do ‚ú± Founder @Cross Change'}]}, {'title': 'Creative Business Cup Istanbul', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'Creative Business Cup Istanbul was the first creative business competition in Istanbul.  It is an original, international format of the Creative Business Network, a Denmark-based organization held annually in applicant countries. We brought the unique format to Istanbul as a host to increase those who are curious about the economic potential of creative professionals, entrepreneurs and companies.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Tugce', 'last_name': 'Akbulut', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Connector ‚ú± Impact Design Startup Curator & Consultant ‚ú± Program Manager @What Design Can Do ‚ú± Founder @Cross Change'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Serdar', 'last_name': 'Paktin', 'name': None, 'headline': 'strategist. sensemaker. semiotician. generalist. | I design concepts across cultures and systems.'}]}, {'title': 'AHRC UK-Turkey Creative Industries Research Fund - Jury Membership', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': None, 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Tugce', 'last_name': 'Akbulut', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Connector ‚ú± Impact Design Startup Curator & Consultant ‚ú± Program Manager @What Design Can Do ‚ú± Founder @Cross Change'}]}, {'title': 'Tradition As a Making Tool _ Phase 1', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': '‚ÄòTradition as a Making Tool‚Äô is a research by design and doing project aimed at how the public space within the busy contemporary city can be designed, programmed, and used. The project tries to give an answer by connecting the design and use of public space to local cultural traditions, traditions which are of great meaning for the communal feeling in the countryside but have been lost within the contemporary city. The aim of the project is to again give meaning to public space to create a more livable, inclusive and durable city.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Tugce', 'last_name': 'Akbulut', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Connector ‚ú± Impact Design Startup Curator & Consultant ‚ú± Program Manager @What Design Can Do ‚ú± Founder @Cross Change'}]}]
